Government should not be afraid to make tough decisions.

Politicians should be concerned with running a smooth country and fixing social problems, not padding their expenses and getting reelected.

The working population can no longer afford to subsidise an ever increasing number of unproductive citizens.

The rights and welfare of hard working citizen’s should always have preference over illegal immigrants, criminals or those who feel they are owed a free ride.

The human rights of the criminal should never outweigh the human rights of their victims or inhibit them receiving fair sentences that will discourage others from offending.

Financial benefits should only be for short term assistance, not a long term alternative to employment.

The view that all life is sacred is no longer practical and thus euthanasia, forced abortion; birth prevention, the death penalty and permanent exile should all be used as ways to prevent overcrowding and maintaining a balanced society.
